metadata.Title: CVE-2022-43995 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: Sudo 1.8.0 through 1.9.12, with the crypt() password backend, contains aplugins/sudoers/auth/passwd.c array-out-of-bounds error that can result ina heap-based buffer over-read. This can be triggered by arbitrary localusers with access to Sudo by entering a password of seven characters orfewer. The impact could vary depending on the system libraries, compiler,and processor architecture.

criterions.comment: sudo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
